page.title: 07CASGLU CALENNIG
page.content: {COLLECTING NEW YEARS GIFTS. This is a custom confined to Welsh rural areas, particularly Dyfed, and has been performed in Llandysul for centuaries. Children go around houses on the morning of{New Years Day } wishing the people good luck for the new year. They knock at the door, and sing or recite a short verse about health and good wishes for the family, and wish everyone inside a{Happy New {Year.}In return they receive small gifts of money or food, The custom has rapidly declined over the years and this year,1985, very few children came collecting because the children today get enough pocket money and food. Also, many children may not have been told about the custom by their parents.
